CommentsTitle: Been drinking sparkling water every day, straight, for over 5 years now.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 1, 2018
CommentsContent: We were buying the glass bottle version at the big-box store, but it is so heavy to tote home!  I convinced my husband to try these, and see how great it is to have the case delivered to our door by Amazon!  Yeah, we're both happy, and we don't have to lug the case of glass bottles home!  Win-win!UPDATE:  According to the Customer Q&A section the manufacturer says this water is 5.3 to 5.6 or so.  It says they  add carbon dioxide for the carbonation, which becomes carbonic acid when dissolved in water.  If  5.6 is correct, that makes this very acidic, which is not healthy at all--especially if you are eating acidic foods like we all do, like meats for instance.  Major bummer.  My husband loves this water and drinks it all day long.  I'm going to try to encourage him to add an alkalizer to the water, something like "Ph10Max", or "AlkazOne", both of which are available on Amazon, and are unflavored drops you can use to alkalize the water.  I'm not sure how well that addition will go with him or the water (don't even know yet if it will make the water go flat), but I'm going to see if he will try it.

CommentsTitle: My order from February 2020 may have made me sick
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 16, 2020
CommentsContent: I tried this product for the first time in Feb. 2020. I only had a few bottles over the course of about a week. I wasn't very impressed as it tasted flat and bitter. One night, I had a bit before sleep and I woke up at 3AM with nausea and a racing heart. I thought I was having a heart attack or panic attack. I ended up sick on and off for months (and am still getting over it as of October 2020). It's slow progress but I am feeling better.Now, it is possible I have been dealing with the "longhaul" form of coronavirus and that it was not the water, but personally, I'm not taking my chances again and I would advise prospective buyers to be very cautious. As a first time drinker of mineral water, I was not familiar with the product. If you are familiar with it, you might be able to recognize any problems with it.There are other 1-star reviewers who mentioned issues with their water. Look for the reviews from circa June-July 2020. One such reviewer mentioned having called the company and them saying Amazon possibly stored it incorrectly and caused plastic to leech into the water. I wonder if I ingested plastic that evening? It may have damaged my organs and for months my body had to repair itself (still getting over it).When I examined my unopened bottles a few months later I noticed a pool of white looking sludge sitting on the bottom. I wasn't sure if that was the "minerals" or what. Could that have been the plastic? Like, does the CO2 cause the plastic to erode/melt over time or something? Also, the bottles had a date of 2016 on them. Wish I noticed that before I drank it several months back.Am I being unfair to only suspect this water? I don't think it is unfair to give a 1-star review for suspecting this water. Because, even if I didn't get sick from this water, I still didn't like it. Flat and bitter. Also, the date on the bottle said 2016, so if they were expired that certainly doesn't help. My theory is that I probably did have corona in late Feb/early March, but it was this water that stressed out my body to cause corona to become a "longhaul" form of inflammation that lasted for months and months.
